column25: poly(A) tags from Arabidopsis leaf tissue
column26: Illumina Genome Analyzer II paired end sequencing; WIld-type PAT from MCIC August 2009
column27: The genome-wide landscape of polyadenylation in Arabidopsis:  evidence for extensive and novel alternative polyadenylation
column28: Illumina Genome Analyzer II paired end sequencing; WIld-type PAT from MCIC August 2009
column29: This sample consists of cDNA tags that query the mRNA-poly(A) junction, prepared using RNA isolated from Arabidopsis leaf tissue.  Plants were grown in a growth room in soil or hydroponically and leaf tissue harvested after 17-20 days.  cDNA was prepared and the desired tags made as described in Wu et al. (submitted).  These paired-end tags are bar-coded and mixed with other samples in the various experiments.  Wild-type leaf tags have the following codes:  5' reads begin with either CATG or ACGT, and 3' reads begin with the sequence NNNCCTTTT.  These codes can be used to extract leaf tags for analysis.

column26: Illumina Genome Analyzer II paired end sequencing; Arabidopsis seed PAT
column27: The genome-wide landscape of polyadenylation in Arabidopsis:  evidence for extensive and novel alternative polyadenylation
column28: Illumina Genome Analyzer II paired end sequencing; Arabidopsis seed PAT
column29: This sample consists of cDNA tags that query the mRNA-poly(A) junction, prepared using RNA isolated from dry Arabidopsis seeds.  cDNA was prepared and the desired tags made as described in Wu et al. (submitted).  These paired-end tags are bar-coded and mixed with other samples in the various experiments.  Wild-type leaf tags have the following codes:  5' reads begin with either CCCATG or CCACGT, and 3' reads begin with the sequence NNNGCTTTT (for tags in the AHQL2 sample) or NNNGGTTTT (for tags in the AHBD2 sample).  These codes can be used to extract seed tags for analysis.
